Class ImageProcessor

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cpirvu.ImageProcessor

  • public class ImageProcessor
extends java.lang.Object

    • Field Summary

      File opened by the given input path.

      If set to true and the file is a directory, then this will use numberOfThreads threads.

      The number of threads to use.
      private int threshold
      This is the value from 0 - 255 of which any pixel that with a brightness greater than the value will be converted to white, and any pixel with a brightness less than this value will be converted to black.

    • Field Detail

      • file

        private java.io.File file
        File opened by the given input path.

      • multithreaded

        private boolean multithreaded
        If set to true and the file is a directory, then this will use numberOfThreads threads.

      • numberOfThreads

        private int numberOfThreads
        The number of threads to use. It only works if multithreaded is set to true. Default value is 5.

      • threshold

        private int threshold
        This is the value from 0 - 255 of which any pixel that with a brightness greater than the value will be converted to white, and any pixel with a brightness less than this value will be converted to black. Default value is 127.

      • force

        private boolean force
        If true, the input images will also be converted to grayscale first (if needed).

    • Constructor Detail

      • ImageProcessor

        public ImageProcessor()

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Starting point of the application. Requires a specific form of the argument(s).
        Parameters:
        args - the CLI arguments. usage: [-M <numberOfThreads>] - if present, the application will use numberOfThreads only if the given path is a directory. If only the [-M] argument is present, the default number of threads is 5. If [-M] is not specified, the application will use only the main thread. [-T <staticThreshold>] - if present, the binarization algorithm will use the given static threshold. The [-T] argument must be followed by the static threshold. If [-T] is not specified, the default static threshold will be set to 127. -P <path> - mandatory argument, the path can be either an image file or a directory containing image files. The path can be relative or absolute (unix style). If containing spaces, it must be enclosed in double quotes. !!! The files must have the extension BMP and contain 24bit images! [-F] if present, the input images will also be converted to grayscale first (if needed). If the input image (or any image from the directory) is not grayscale and this flag is not present, then the program will fail.

        If the first argument is "help", the application will only print CLI usage info.

      • printError

        private static void printError(java.lang.String[] args)
        Basic method that prints an error message if the input arguments are invalid.
        Parameters:
        args - the command line arguments

      • printHelp

        private void printHelp()

      • decodeArgs

        private boolean decodeArgs(java.lang.String[] args)
        Method that decodes the given CLI arguments. If this methods returns false, the execution of the program should end, as the input arguments were invalid.
        Parameters:
        args - the CLI arguments.
        Returns:
        boolean stating whether or not the program should continue execution.
